summary: The majority of support tickets are related to the 'Talent Acquisition (TA)' product area, with 'Net New Configuration' and 'Gap in Product Understanding' being the most common root causes. All tickets are marked with priority 'P2'. The majority of tickets are 'Closed', followed by 'Solved'. There is no information specified about the implementation phase of the issues.

patterns.title: Product Area with Most Tickets
patterns.description: The product area 'Talent Acquisition (TA)' has the highest number of support tickets, indicating potential areas of difficulty for users or areas where the product could be improved.

patterns.title: Common Root Causes
patterns.description: The most common root causes are 'Net New Configuration' and 'Gap in Product Understanding'. This could indicate that users are having difficulties understanding new features or changes in the product, or that there is a lack of clear documentation or guidance.

patterns.title: Status of Tickets
patterns.description: The majority of tickets are 'Closed', followed by 'Solved'. This indicates that the support team is actively addressing and resolving issues, but there are still a number of 'Open' and 'Pending' tickets that need attention.

recommendations: Improve documentation and user guidance for the 'Talent Acquisition (TA)' product area, particularly around new configurations.
Provide additional training or resources to help users better understand the product, potentially reducing the number of tickets related to 'Gap in Product Understanding'.
Continue to prioritize resolving 'Open' and 'Pending' tickets to ensure all user issues are addressed in a timely manner.
